title: 109_hr5144
content:
There is no text provided in the prev_chunk, so I will summarize the curr_chunk as follows:

SECTION 1. INFORMATION SHARING. SECTION 1. INFORMATION SHARING.

The purposes of this section are to establish supply chain security cooperation between the Department of Homeland Security and the private sector, facilitate information interchange on security risks, and develop a secure electronic data interchange system for sharing risk information with appropriate private sector entities. The Secretary of Homeland Security shall consult with the Commercial Operations Advisory in developing this system. The Secretary will consult with various public and private sector entities, including importers, exporters, carriers, customs brokers, and freight forwarders, to establish procedures for receiving and storing supply chain security information. The information collected will be used solely for security purposes and not for entry determination or commercial enforcement. Compliance with any regulations is not implied by submitting voluntary information through the system. The Secretary will develop protocols for private sector personnel to access the system under subsection (b), including designated security officers from low-risk companies in the Customs-Trade Partnership Against Terrorism program. Information voluntarily submitted by the private sector will be confidential and exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act. The information voluntarily submitted by the private sector will be confidential and exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act. It shall not be used in civil actions without consent, except for criminal investigations or congressional disclosure. The private sector's voluntarily submitted information is confidential and exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act. It can only be used in criminal investigations or congressional disclosure. The section does not limit government entities from obtaining supply chain security information under applicable law. Penalties for unauthorized disclosure of protected supply chain security information include fines, imprisonment, and removal from office. The Secretary has the authority to issue warnings and take actions to protect the confidentiality of voluntarily submitted information. In this section, disclosure of voluntarily submitted supply chain security information must include the source and exclude proprietary or sensitive details. Definitions for "Department" and "Secretary" are provided as the Department of Homeland Security and Secretary of Homeland Security, respectively.
